Detailed Description

Transaction call-backs.

These are invoked by osd (or underlying transaction engine) when transaction changes state.

Call-backs are used by upper layers to modify transaction parameters and to perform some actions on for each transaction state transition. Typical example is mdt registering call-back to write into last-received file before each transaction commit.
